result.markdown: --- title: "Penguin Analysis" author: "Alberto F Cabrera" format: html: code-link: true code-fold: true code-summary: "Show the code" self-contained: true embed-resources: true toc: true theme: Zephyr number-sections: false execute: warning: false message: false echo: false editor_options: chunk_output_type: console fig-cap-location: margin --- ## Introduction This is our first quarto document. ::: {.cell} ::: ## Loading penguin data Loading penguin data and summarizing it. The dataset comes from [Palmerpenguins](https://allisonhorst.github.io/palmerpenguins/). It describes the *physical* characteristics of three **penguin** ***species***. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Read the clean dataset #Option offered by the author #data <- readRDS(file = "../data/data_clean.rds") data <- readRDS("~/Documents/R-books/productive-r-workflow/data/data_clean.rds") #Sumarizing data summary(data) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` species island bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm Length:342 Length:342 Min. :32.10 Min. :13.10 Class :character Class :character 1st Qu.:39.27 1st Qu.:15.57 Mode :character Mode :character Median :44.50 Median :17.30 Mean :43.96 Mean :17.14 3rd Qu.:48.50 3rd Qu.:18.70 Max. :59.60 Max. :21.50 NA's :2 NA's :2 flipper_length_mm body_mass_g sex year Min. :172.0 Min. :2700 Length:342 Min. :2007 1st Qu.:190.0 1st Qu.:3550 Class :character 1st Qu.:2007 Median :197.0 Median :4050 Mode :character Median :2008 Mean :201.0 Mean :4203 Mean :2008 3rd Qu.:213.2 3rd Qu.:4756 3rd Qu.:2009 Max. :231.0 Max. :6300 Max. :2009 NA's :2 NA's :2 id Min. : 1.00 1st Qu.: 88.25 Median :173.50 Mean :173.30 3rd Qu.:258.75 Max. :344.00 ``` ::: ::: Calculating mean bill length for different species and islands ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Calculating mean bill length for different species and islands using dplyr data |> filter(species == "Adelie") |> group_by(island) |> summarize(mean_bill_length = round(mean(bill_length_mm, na.rm = TRUE), 2)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 2 island mean_bill_length 1 Biscoe 39.0 2 Dream 38.5 3 Torgersen 39.0 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} data |> ggplot( aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm) ) + geom_point(color = "#69b3a2") + labs( x = "Bill Length (mm)", y = "Bill Depth (mm)", title = paste("Surprising relationship?") ) + theme_minimal() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Relationship between bill length and bill depth. All data points included.](analysis_files/figure-html/plotting_penguin_data_detailed-1.png){fig-align='center' width=480} ::: ::: It is also interesting to note that `bill length` a and `bill depth` are quite different from one specie to another. This is summarized in the 2 tables below: ::: {.cell layout-ncol="2"} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 2 species average_bill_length 1 Adelie 38.8 2 Chinstrap 48.8 3 Gentoo 47.5 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 2 species average_bill_depth 1 Adelie 18.3 2 Chinstrap 18.4 3 Gentoo 15.0 ``` ::: ::: ## Invoking function & performing plots Loading the create-scatterplot function. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #Invoking functions file #This option works if rending the quarto document source(file = "functions.R") #This option works if rendering the quarto document #source(file = "../R/functions.R") #This option works if ran individually #source(file = "R/functions.R") # Use the function in functions.R #create_scatterplot(data, "Adelie", "Torgersen") ``` ::: ### Scatter plot options Scatter plot with width = 3 ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](analysis_files/figure-html/scatter_plot_width_3_inches-1.png){width=288} ::: ::: Scatter plot with width = 6 ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](analysis_files/figure-html/scatter_plot_width_6_inches-1.png){width=576} ::: ::: Scatter plot with width = 9 ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](analysis_files/figure-html/scatter_plot_width_9_inches-1.png){width=864} ::: ::: Aligning the figure of 6 inches Aligning to the center ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](analysis_files/figure-html/scatter_plot_width_6_inches_center-1.png){fig-align='center' width=576} ::: ::: Aligning to the left ::: {.cell layout-align="left"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](analysis_files/figure-html/scatter_plot_width_6_inches_left-1.png){fig-align='left' width=576} ::: ::: Aligning to the right ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} create_scatterplot(data,"Adelie","Torgesen") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](analysis_files/figure-html/scatter_plot_width_6_right-1.png){width=576} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} create_scatterplot(data,"Gentoo","Biscoe") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](analysis_files/figure-html/scatter_plot_width_6_right-2.png){width=576} ::: ::: Figure capture margins ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} create_scatterplot(data,"Adelie","Torgesen") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](analysis_files/figure-html/capture_margins-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} create_scatterplot(data,"Gentoo","Biscoe") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](analysis_files/figure-html/capture_margins-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: Adding equations: This formula $f(x) = x^2$ is an example The $X^2 =$ is Adding a kable() report ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(knitr) library(palmerpenguins) table_penguins <- palmerpenguins::penguins %>% group_by(species) %>% summarise(average_bill_depth = mean(bill_depth_mm, na.rm = TRUE), average_bill_depth_mm = mean(bill_depth_mm, na.rm = TRUE)) kable(table_penguins) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} |species | average_bill_depth| average_bill_depth_mm| |:---------|------------------:|---------------------:| |Adelie | 18.34636| 18.34636| |Chinstrap | 18.42059| 18.42059| |Gentoo | 14.98211| 14.98211| ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(knitr) library(palmerpenguins) bill_length_per_specie <- palmerpenguins::penguins |> group_by(species) |> summarise(average_bill_length = mean(bill_length_mm, na.rm = TRUE)) kable(bill_length_per_specie) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} |species | average_bill_length| |:---------|-------------------:| |Adelie | 38.79139| |Chinstrap | 48.83382| |Gentoo | 47.50488| ::: ```{.r .cell-code} bill_depth_per_specie <- palmerpenguins::penguins %>% group_by(species) %>% summarise(average_bill_depth = mean(bill_depth_mm, na.rm = TRUE)) kable(bill_depth_per_specie) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} |species | average_bill_depth| |:---------|------------------:| |Adelie | 18.34636| |Chinstrap | 18.42059| |Gentoo | 14.98211| ::: ```{.r .cell-code} bill_length_adelie <- bill_length_per_specie %>% filter(species == "Adelie") %>% pull(average_bill_length) %>% round(2) ``` ::: For instance, the average bill length for the specie Adelie is 38.79.
